entry.title: You‚Äôre Safe, I‚Äôm Here
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,384Chapters: 13/22Kudos: 22

Summary: The Beacon Hills Preserve had always been quiet in the early evenings, the kind of quiet that hummed in the bones of anyone supernatural. Most people would call it peaceful. Liam Dunbar called it suspicious. He walked a few steps ahead, his eyes flicking between the trees, inhaling like he expected to catch a threat in the damp leaves or the wind. His shoulders were coiled tight‚Äîtoo tight for a patrol that was supposed to be routine. The sun hovered low enough to stain the whole forest with orange and copper. Behind him, Theo Raeken let out a slow, theatrical sigh. ‚ÄúDunbar,‚Äù he said, voice low but full of a patience he very smugly claimed he didn‚Äôt have, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre clenching your jaw so hard I can hear your molars trying to fuse.‚Äù

entry.title: the shape of being chosen
entry.summary:
Author: sourwolf97

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,555Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 65

Summary: Derek huffs, the softest hesitation of a laugh, warm against his skin. ‚ÄúYou talk in your sleep,‚Äù he counters quietly. ‚ÄúA lot.‚Äù Panic flickers up his spine before Stiles can stop it. He forces his voice to stay light, easy. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs probably just my soul trying to escape my body,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt blame it, really.‚Äù But inside, he‚Äôs scrolling through mental footage of every night he‚Äôs ever crashed here, cataloguing every murky, half-remembered dream, wondering what words might have slipped out when his guard was down. Did he say Derek‚Äôs name? Did he say I love you? Did he say don‚Äôt leave? Did he confess the whole pathetic thesis statement his brain has been footnoting for months now: I know this isn‚Äôt actually anything for you, and that‚Äôs fine, I‚Äôm fine, please just let me keep pretending until you get bored?

entry.title: LIKE A WOLF HOWLING
entry.summary:
Author: TheSaintRyan

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,930Chapters: 12/37Kudos: 1

Summary: Twelve years after Adda's rampage, a now adult Eli Hale, along with Boyd and Erica's twin daughters, is working as a supernatural contractor; traveling the US and helping people out with problems of an occult nature. When the spirits of The Grey become frightened, and a powerful hunter targets the three, Eli must return home to Beacon Hills and gather the Hale Pack to once more defend their home. A mysterious and powerful hunter, a solo artist, travels the nation in an effort to destroy the supernatural threat to humanity. When she rescues an orphaned werewolf child, the delicate threads holding her paradigm together begin to unravel. Who is this child, really? Why is she so convinced that something bigger is at play here? And why, when she follows a target to Beacon Hills, do the streets seem so familiar? Or; The Parking lot is mostly empty. The neon sign which reads VACANCIES is buzzing, loud. In the car, Amanda and Ali say something back and forth, then look at you, and then speak again. You think that they resent you for dragging them out here, yet they won't leave.

Derek started to answer, but was quickly silenced by Stiles‚Äô harsh glare. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt answer that.‚Äù‚ÄúSo does that mean you‚Äôll help?‚Äù Tara asked hopefully.‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt look like we have much of a choice,‚Äù Derek huffed. Glowering at the pretty girl when she squealed and jumped up to hug Stiles. After her hundredth ‚Äòthank you‚Äô she walked through the wall, leaving Stiles and Derek alone once more. ‚ÄúWhy do I have a feeling that we‚Äôre going to regret this?‚Äù‚ÄúOh, that‚Äôs because we probably are,‚Äù Stiles said brightly and Derek grimaced at him. ‚ÄúWhat? I‚Äôm only being realistic. Besides, it‚Äôs not everyday a vengeful water spirit asks for your help.‚Äù____It's been 5 years since Stiles had saved all the supernatural creatures in Beacon Hills from the mass genocide started by Kate. With new friends and old faces come more risks and stranger enemies. Let's hope Stiles and Derek can get their shit together before everything goes to hell in a hand-basket.
